for {{name}}.

Click "Email Summary" below to email a summary of your child's milestones to yourself or other care providers.

Click "Show Doctor" to share a summary during your child's doctor visit.

If you have noted any concerns or selected ‚Äúnot yet‚Äù or ‚Äúnot sure‚Äù for any milestones, talk to your child‚Äôs doctor, share the summary, ask for developmental screening, and go to <0>cdc.gov/FindEl</0> to learn more about services that can help. info.aboutThisAppText:
This app was developed by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention‚Äôs ‚ÄúLearn the Signs. Act Early.‚Äù program (<0>www.cdc.gov/ActEarly</0>) with contribution from Dr. Rosa Arriaga and students from the Computing for Good program at 
the Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA.

This app includes the following features to make tracking your child‚Äôs important developmental milestones easy and fun: 

<1>Add A Child</1> - enter personalized information about your child or multiple children

<1>Milestone Tracker</1> - track your child‚Äôs developmenal progress by looking for important milestones using an interactive, illustrated checklist

<1>Milestone Photos and Videos</1> - know what each milestone looks like so that you can better identify them in your own child

<1>Tips and Activities</1> - support your child‚Äôs development at every age

<1>When to Act Early</1> - know when it‚Äôs time to ‚Äúact early‚Äù and talk with your child‚Äôs doctor about developmental concerns

<1>Appointments</1> - keep track of your child‚Äôs doctors‚Äô appointments and get reminders about recommended developmental screenings

<1>Milestone Results</1> - get a summary of your child‚Äôs milestones to view, and share with or email to your child‚Äôs doctor and other important care providers

The use of this app is NOT a substitute for the use of validated, standardized devleopmental screening tools as recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics. 

For more information and free tools to help you track your child‚Äôs milestones, visit <2>www.cdc.gov/ActEarly</2>
info.privacyPolicyText: CDC does not collect or share any personal information that can be used to identify you or your child.
info.title: Info

milestoneChecklist.actEarlyMessage1: If you select any of the items below, it‚Äôs important to act early by talking with your child‚Äôs doctor. Don‚Äôt wait. Acting early can make a real difference! For more information visit <0>www.cdc.gov/Concerned</0>

notifications.appointment1DayBeforeBody: {{name}} has a doctor‚Äôs appointment tomorrow. Write down any concerns or questions you have and share them with the doctor. If this is a well-child checkup, also share {{hisHersTag}} milestone checklist. üìù

notifications.nextMilestoneBirthdayNotificationBody: {{name}} is {{childAgeFormatted}} old üéÇ! Complete {{hisHersTag}} {{milestoneAgeFormatted}} milestone checklist today!
notifications.recommendation1DayPassedBody: Acting early on missed milestones or other concerns can make a big difference. While each child develops differently, some differences can be a cause for concern. Set a doctor‚Äôs appointment to share {{name}}‚Äôs summary and ask for developmental screening. Don‚Äôt wait. üóì

onboardingInfo.welcome2p: CDC‚Äôs Milestone Tracker makes tracking your child‚Äôs development easy and fun!

onboardingParentProfile.territoryInfo:
Milestone Tracker asks for state and territory to learn where the app is being used. 

It does not collect or share any personal information that could be used to identify you or your child.

revisit.description:
A summary of your responses and other helpful information are below.

Share this with your child‚Äôs doctor and other care providers. Remember, if you ever become concerned about {{name}}‚Äôs development, talk with the doctor and ask for developmental screening and services that can help make a big difference. Don‚Äôt wait.

<0>ACT EARLY by talking with {{name}}‚Äôs doctor right away about:</0>
revisit.notYetText: Ask the doctor for developmental screening and about services that can help. Remember, acting early on concerns and missed milestones can make a big difference for {{name}}. Don‚Äôt wait. Learn more about how to help your child at: <0>cdc.gov/Concerned</0>
revisit.thankYouText:
Thank you for using
CDC‚Äôs Milestone Tracker
App for tracking {{childName}}'s
milestones.
revisit.thankYouText2:
Thank you again for using CDC‚Äôs Milestone Tracker App!

Learn more about developmental milestones and acting early on concerns at <0>cdc.gov/ActEarly.</0>
revisit.timeToCelebrate: Take time to CELEBRATE {{name}} having reached these important milestones:
revisit.yellowTip: You know {{childName}} best. If {{heSheTag}} is missing milestones or you ever become concerned about {{hisHersTag}} development, talk with the doctor, share your concerns, and ask for developmental screening.

settings.statePrivacyLanguage:
Milestone Tracker asks for state and territory to learn where the app is being used. 
It does not collect or share any personal information that could be used to identify you or your child.

tipsAndActivities.subtitle: You can help your {{babyOrChild}} learn and grow. Talk, read, sing, and play together every day. Below are some activities to enjoy with your {{childAge}} old {{babyOrChild}} today.
tipsAndActivities.title: Tips and Activities
